description: Critical LSASS process memory dump detected on workstation HR-WKS-089 (10.50.15.142) 14 minutes after initial RDP access. Medusa threat actor executed procdump.exe to dump Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) process memory containing credentials for all logged-in users. Command executed: 'C:\Users\Public\procdump.exe -accepteula -ma lsass.exe C:\Users\Public\lsass.dmp'. The 52MB dump file was created successfully and immediately exfiltrated to external server 45.141.84.223:443 via HTTPS POST request. The ProcDump utility (legitimate Sysinternals tool) was downloaded to C:\Users\Public\ from attacker-controlled server. Analysis of the dump file reveals it contained credentials for 8 domain accounts including Domain Admin account 'IT-Admin' and service account 'svc-backup'. These credentials enabled the lateral movement phase of the Medusa ransomware campaign. The attacker accessed the system using previously compromised jsmith@victimcorp.local account.
policy_description: LSASS memory dumping - Medusa ransomware credential theft
policy_recommendation: Force immediate password reset for all 8 compromised accounts (priority: IT-Admin, svc-backup), delete lsass.dmp file, quarantine procdump.exe, block IP 45.141.84.223, enable LSA protection and Credential Guard on all endpoints, investigate lateral movement using stolen credentials
mitre_att&ck_technique: T1003.001 - OS Credential Dumping: LSASS Memory
